body.header:
Read the arguments on the right and the counter-arguments on the left. Match a counter-argument to each argument by writing the appropriate letter in each gap. Check your answer by reading the completed composition.
Sample answer

section.p: 3. This paragraph is all about the how such images affect children.
A Children may be traumatised by disturbing images.
B. Important news events must not be 'censored' for the public, even if the images are unpleasant.
C. Pictures have more impact than words.
D. Some political systems work better when people know exactly what is happening in the world.
E. Television news reports often trivialise tragic events by turning them into entertainment.
F. Too much exposure to disturbing images may accustom us to them, so we no longer react.
G. Victims of violence may not want to be shown on television.
H. Viewers are not always given enough warning before disturbing images are shown.
I. Viewers want to be entertained, not distressed, when they watch television.
